<!-- Area/postal codes & others --> |postal_code_type = [[ZIP code]] |postal_code = 91107 |area_code = [[Area code 626|626]] |blank_name = [[Federal Information Processing Standard|FIPS code]] |blank_info = 06-20984 |blank1_name = [[Geographic Names Information System|GNIS]] feature ID |blank1_info = 1660585 |website = |footnotes = }} '''East Pasadena''' is a [[census-designated place]] (CDP) in [[Los Angeles County, California|Los Angeles County]], [[California]], [[United States]]. The population was 6,144 at the 2010 census, up from 6,045 at the 2000 census.
==Geography== East Pasadena is located at {{Coord|34|8|24|N|118|4|40|W|type:city}} (34.140057, -118.077650).{{GR|1}}
According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the CDP has a total area of {{convert|1.3|sqmi|km2}}, all land.
The land area of East Pasadena is separated into two non-contiguous segments: *The main portion, bordered by Pasadena city limits on the North, [[California Boulevard]] on the south, [[Michillinda Avenue]] ([[Arcadia, California|Arcadia]] city limits) on the east, and San Gabriel Boulevard on the west. *A smaller district to the west, bordered by Del Mar Boulevard to the north, [[San Marino, California|San Marino]] city limits to the south, Berkeley Avenue to the west and San Gabriel Boulevard to the east.
The community has become considerably smaller as the city of Pasadena has expanded its boundaries to include more of the unincorporated area of East Pasadena.<ref>http://www.cityofpasadena.net</ref>
==Demographics== {{USCensusPop | 1990=5910 | 2000=6045 | 2010=6144 | footnote=source:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.census.gov/prod/www/abs/decennial/index.html |title=CENSUS OF POPULATION AND HOUSING (1790-2000) |publisher=[[U.S. Census Bureau]] |accessdate=2010-07-17}}</ref> }} ===2010=== The [[2010 United States Census]]<ref>{{USCensus-2010CA}}</ref> reported that East Pasadena had a population of 6,144. The [[population density]] was 4,645.1 people per square mile (1,793.5/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of East Pasadena was 3,183 (51.8%) [[White (U.S. Census)|White]], 183 (3.0%) [[African American (U.S. Census)|African American]], 47 (0.8%) [[Native American (U.S. Census)|Native American]], 1,589 (25.9%) [[Asian (U.S. Census)|Asian]], 7 (0.1%) [[Pacific Islander (U.S. Census)|Pacific Islander]], 857 (13.9%) from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 278 (4.5%) from two or more races. [[Hispanic (U.S. Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Latino (U.S. Census)|Latino]] of any race were 2,139 persons (34.8%).
The Census reported that 6,119 people (99.6% of the population) lived in households, 7 (0.1%) lived in non-institutionalized group quarters, and 18 (0.3%) were institutionalized.
There were 2,096 households, out of which 704 (33.6%) had children under the age of 18 living in them, 1,158 (55.2%) were [[marriage|opposite-sex married couples]] living together, 241 (11.5%) had a female householder with no husband present, 115 (5.5%) had a male householder with no wife present. There were 98 (4.7%) [[POSSLQ|unmarried opposite-sex partnerships]], and 14 (0.7%) [[same-sex partnerships|same-sex married couples or partnerships]]. 441 households (21.0%) were made up of individuals and 178 (8.5%) had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.92. There were 1,514 [[family (U.S. Census)|families]] (72.2% of all households); the average family size was 3.37.
The population was spread out with 1,303 people (21.2%) under the age of 18, 510 people (8.3%) aged 18 to 24, 1,645 people (26.8%) aged 25 to 44, 1,729 people (28.1%) aged 45 to 64, and 957 people (15.6%) who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 40.5 years. For every 100 females there were 97.3 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 96.0 males.
There were 2,184 housing units at an average density of 1,651.2 per square mile (637.5/kmÂ²), of which 1,435 (68.5%) were owner-occupied, and 661 (31.5%) were occupied by renters. The homeowner vacancy rate was 1.3%; the rental vacancy rate was 2.4%. 4,286 people (69.8% of the population) lived in owner-occupied housing units and 1,833 people (29.8%) lived in rental housing units.
===2000=== As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 6,045 people, 2,038 households, and 1,502 families residing in the CDP. The [[population density]] was 4,586.6 inhabitants per square mile (1,768.2/kmÂ²). There were 2,124 housing units at an average density of 1,611.6 per square mile (621.3/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the CDP was 55.70% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 2.55% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.79% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 20.03% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 0.05% [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], 14.43% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 6.45% from two or more races. 35.24% of the population were [[Hispanics in the United States|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race.
There were 2,038 households out of which 34.6% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 58.0% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 10.7% had a female householder with no husband present, and 26.3% were non-families. 21.3% of all households were made up of individuals and 7.6% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.95 and the average family size was 3.43.
In the CDP the population was spread out with 24.6% under the age of 18, 8.4% from 18 to 24, 29.6% from 25 to 44, 23.8% from 45 to 64, and 13.6% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 37 years. For every 100 females there were 94.6 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 91.2 males.
The median income for a household in the CDP was $53,378, and the median income for a family was $61,531. Males had a median income of $50,208 versus $35,104 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the CDP was $34,548. About 6.1% of families and 9.4% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 12.6% of those under age 18 and 4.0% of those age 65 or over.
==Politics== In the [[California State Legislature|state legislature]] East Pasadena is located in the 21st and 29th [[California State Senate|Senate]] Districts, represented by Democrat [[Jack Scott (politician)|Jack Scott]] and Republican [[Bob Huff]] respectively, and in the 44th [[California State Assembly|Assembly]] District, represented by Democrat [[Anthony J. Portantino]]. Federally, East Pasadena is located in California's [[California's 26th congressional district|26th]] and [[California's 29th congressional district|29th]] congressional districts, which have [[Cook Partisan Voting Index|Cook PVIs]] of R +4 and D +12 respectively<ref>{{cite web | title = Will Gerrymandered Districts Stem the Wave of Voter Unrest? | publisher = Campaign Legal Center Blog | url=http://www.clcblog.org/blog_item-85.html | accessdate = 2008-02-10}}</ref> and is represented by Republican [[David Dreier]] and Democrat [[Adam Schiff]] respectively.
The [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]] (LASD) operates the Temple Station in [[Temple City, California|Temple City]], serving East Pasadena.<ref>"[http://www.lasd.org/stations/for1/temple/index.html Temple Station]." [[Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department]]. Retrieved on January 21, 2010.</ref>
